definitions.definition: To take control of; to seize by force or stratagem.
examples: to capture an enemy, a vessel, or a criminal
The paintings in the gallery really captured my imagination.

definitions.definition: To store (as in sounds or image) for later revisitation.
examples: She captured the sounds of a subway station on tape.
She captured the details of the fresco in a series of photographs.
His film adaptation captured the spirit of the original work.
In her latest masterpiece, she captured the essence of Venice.

definitions.definition: To remove or take control of an opponent’s piece in a game (e.g., chess , go , checkers ).
examples: He captured his opponent’s queen on the 15th move.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To take control of; to seize by force or stratagem.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figurative ) To take hold of.
( transitive ) To store (as in sounds or image) for later revisitation.
( transitive ) To remove or take control of an opponent’s piece in a game (e.g., chess , go , checkers ).
